ctu_text: ", "answer": "Provision exists under MIDH for organizing seminars, conferences, workshops, exhibitions, Kisan Melas, horticulture shows etc for creating awareness among farmers. Assistance is provided for organizing event at international level @100% of the cost to the maximum of Rs. 7. 50 lakh per event of 4 days.

ctu_text: "}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "The key objectives of the Mission are as follows:"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u2022\tPromote holistic growth of horticulture sector, including bamboo and coconut through area based regionally differentiated strategies, which includes research, technology promotion, extension, post-harvest management, processing and marketing, in consonance with comparative advantage of each State/region and its diverse agro-climatic features"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u2022\tEncourage aggregation of farmers into farmer groups like FIGs/FPOs and FPCs to bring economy of scale and scope. "}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u2022\tEnhance horticulture production, augment farmers, income and strengthen nutritional security;"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u2022\tImprove productivity by way of quality germplasm, planting material and water use efficiency through Micro Irrigation. "}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u2022\tSupport skill development and create employment generation opportunities for rural youth in horticulture and post-harvest management, especially in the cold chain sector. "}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Under MIDH, financial assistance is provided for following major interventions/activities:"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u2022\tSetting up of nurseries, tissue culture units for production of quality seed and planting material.

Step 03: State Horticulture Mission will finalise the entrepreneur’s proposals received from the District Horticulture Mission Step 04: Applicant’s proposal will be appraised based on MIDH’s guidelines Step 05: If approved, financial assistance will be released to beneficiary "}], "schemeDefinitions": [], "eligibilityCriteria": {"eligibilityDescription_md": "All farmers / registered societies / state governments are eligible for the scheme ", "eligibilityDescription": [{"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "All farmers / registered societies / state governments are eligible for the scheme"}]}]}}, "slug": "midh"}, "schemeDataHi": {"_id": "650a9f8f7846de4ead18a102", "hi": null, "slug": "midh"}, "faqs": {"status": "Success", "statusCode": 200, "errorDescription": "", "error": "{}", "data": {"_id": "650aa01e7846de4ead18a18e", "en": {"faqs": [{"question": "Can a beneficiary avail assistance for similar activity from two sub schemes of MIDH, like for cold storage? 2)	Promotion of R&D technologies for cultivation, production, post-harvest management and processing with special focus on cold chain infrastructure for extending the shelf life of perishables
3)	Improvement in post harvest management, processing for value addition and marketing infrastructure. 
", "briefDescription": "In 2014-15, the Government of India launched Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH) subsuming the ongoing schemes viz. , NHM, HMNEH, CDB, NHB, CIH and NBM. ", "exclusions_md": "", "detailedDescription": [{"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "MIDH covers horticulture items such as, fruits, vegetables, root & tuber crops, mushrooms, spices, flowers, aromatic plants, coconut, cashew, cocoa and bamboo.

ctu_text: "}]}, {"type": "table_cell", "children": [{"text": "Sub-scheme"}]}, {"type": "table_cell", "children": [{"text": "Area of Operation"}]}, {"type": "table_cell", "children": [{"text": "Funding pattern"}]}]}, {"type": "table_row", "children": [{"type": "table_cell", "children": [{"text": "1"}]}, {"type": "table_cell", "children": [{"text": "National Horticulture Mission (NHM)"}]}, {"type": "table_cell", "children": [{"text": "All states and Union territories except NE and Himalayan states/UTs"}]}, {"type": "table_cell", "children": [{"text": "60:40"}]}]}, {"type": "table_row", "children": [{"type": "table_cell", "children": [{"text": "2"}]}, {"type": "table_cell", "children": [{"text": "Horticulture Mission for North-East & Himalayan States (HMNEH)"}]}, {"type": "table_cell", "children": [{"text": "NE and Himalayan states/UTs"}]}, {"type": "table_cell", "children": [{"text": "90:10"}]}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "National Horticulture Mission (NHM) was launched in the year 2005-06 and aims at the holistic development of the horticulture sector by ensuring forward and backward linkage through a cluster approach with the active participation of all stakeholders. Major interventions under NHM include, supply of quality planting material through establishment of nurseries and tissue culture units, production and productivity improvement programmes through area expansion and rejuvenation, technology promotion, technology dissemination, human resource development, creation of infrastructure for post harvest management and marketing in consonance with the comparative advantages of each State/region and their diverse agro-climatic conditions. "}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Horticulture Mission for North East and Himalayan States (HMNEH) aims to achieve overall development of Horticulture in NE and Himalayan states. The mission covers all NE States including Sikkim and three Himalayan states of Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand.
